metadata.title: CVE-2018-5126 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 58. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort thatsome of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
